title: Of Credit
text: In the case of an individual who is a citizen or resident of the United States (within the meaning of section7701(a)(9)), there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the aggregate amount of qualified contributions made by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

logical_structure.result: In the case of an individual who is a citizen or resident of the United States (within the meaning of section7701(a)(9)), there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year an amount equal to the aggregate amount of qualified contributions made by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(a)Allowance Of Credit—In the case of an individual who is a citizen or resident of the United States (within
                  the meaning of section7701(a)(9)), there shall be allowed as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for
                  the taxable year an amount equal to the aggregate amount of qualified contributions
                  made by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

title: General
text: The credit allowed under subsection(a)to any taxpayer for any taxable year shall not exceed $1,700.

logical_structure.result: The credit allowed under subsection(a)to any taxpayer for any taxable year shall not exceed $1,700.

raw_text: I.R.C. § 25F(b)(1)In General—The credit allowed under subsection(a)to any taxpayer for any taxable year shall not exceed $1,700.

title: Based On State Credit
text: The amount allowed as a credit under subsection(a)for a taxable year shall be reduced by the amount allowed as a credit on any State tax return of the taxpayer for qualified contributions made by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

logical_structure.result: The amount allowed as a credit under subsection(a)for a taxable year shall be reduced by the amount allowed as a credit on any State tax return of the taxpayer for qualified contributions made by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(b)(2)Reduction Based On State Credit—The amount allowed as a credit under subsection(a)for a taxable year shall be reduced by the amount allowed as a credit on any State
                     tax return of the taxpayer for qualified contributions made by the taxpayer during
                     the taxable year.

title: State
text: The term ‘covered State’ means one of the States, or the District of Columbia, that, for a calendar year, voluntarily elects to participate under this section and to identify scholarship granting organizations in the State, in accordance with subsection(g).

logical_structure.result: The term ‘covered State’ means one of the States, or the District of Columbia, that, for a calendar year, voluntarily elects to participate under this section and to identify scholarship granting organizations in the State, in accordance with subsection(g).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(c)(1)Covered State—The term ‘covered State’ means one of the States, or the District of Columbia, that,
                     for a calendar year, voluntarily elects to participate under this section and to identify
                     scholarship granting organizations in the State, in accordance with subsection(g).

title: Student
text: The term ‘eligible student’ means an individual who——is a member of a household with an income which, for the calendar year prior to the date of the application for a scholarship, is not greater than 300 percent of the area median gross income (as such term is used in section42), and—is eligible to enroll in a public elementary or secondary school.

logical_structure.result: The term ‘eligible student’ means an individual who——is a member of a household with an income which, for the calendar year prior to the date of the application for a scholarship, is not greater than 300 percent of the area median gross income (as such term is used in section42), and—is eligible to enroll in a public elementary or secondary school.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(c)(2)Eligible Student—The term ‘eligible student’ means an individual who—I.R.C. § 25F(c)(2)(A)—is a member of a household with an income which, for the calendar year prior to the
                        date of the application for a scholarship, is not greater than 300 percent of the
                        area median gross income (as such term is used in section42), andI.R.C. § 25F(c)(2)(B)—is eligible to enroll in a public elementary or secondary school.

title: Contribution
text: The term ‘qualified contribution’ means a charitable contribution of cash to a scholarship granting organization that uses the contribution to fund scholarships for eligible students solely within the State in which the organization is listed pursuant to subsection(g).

logical_structure.result: The term ‘qualified contribution’ means a charitable contribution of cash to a scholarship granting organization that uses the contribution to fund scholarships for eligible students solely within the State in which the organization is listed pursuant to subsection(g).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(c)(3)Qualified Contribution—The term ‘qualified contribution’ means a charitable contribution of cash to a scholarship
                     granting organization that uses the contribution to fund scholarships for eligible
                     students solely within the State in which the organization is listed pursuant to subsection(g).

title: Elementary Or Secondary Education Expense
text: The term ‘qualified elementary or secondary education expense’ means any expense of an eligible student which is described in section530(b)(3)(A).

logical_structure.result: The term ‘qualified elementary or secondary education expense’ means any expense of an eligible student which is described in section530(b)(3)(A).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(c)(4)Qualified Elementary Or Secondary Education Expense—The term ‘qualified elementary or secondary education expense’ means any expense of
                     an eligible student which is described in section530(b)(3)(A).

title: Granting Organization
text: The term ‘scholarship granting organization’ means any organization——which——is described in section501(c)(3)and exempt from tax under section501(a), and—is not a private foundation,—which prevents the co-mingling of qualified contributions with other amounts by maintaining one or more separate accounts exclusively for qualified contributions,—which satisfies the requirements of subsection(d), and—which is included on the list submitted for the applicable covered State under subsection(g)for the applicable year.

logical_structure.result: The term ‘scholarship granting organization’ means any organization——which——is described in section501(c)(3)and exempt from tax under section501(a), and—is not a private foundation,—which prevents the co-mingling of qualified contributions with other amounts by maintaining one or more separate accounts exclusively for qualified contributions,—which satisfies the requirements of subsection(d), and—which is included on the list submitted for the applicable covered State under subsection(g)for the applicable year.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(c)(5)Scholarship Granting Organization—The term ‘scholarship granting organization’ means any organization—I.R.C. § 25F(c)(5)(A)—which—I.R.C. § 25F(c)(5)(A)(i)—is described in section501(c)(3)and exempt from tax under section501(a), andI.R.C. § 25F(c)(5)(A)(ii)—is not a private foundation,I.R.C. § 25F(c)(5)(B)—which prevents the co-mingling of qualified contributions with other amounts by maintaining
                        one or more separate accounts exclusively for qualified contributions,I.R.C. § 25F(c)(5)(C)—which satisfies the requirements of subsection(d), andI.R.C. § 25F(c)(5)(D)—which is included on the list submitted for the applicable covered State under subsection(g)for the applicable year.

title: General
text: An organization meets the requirements of this subsection if——such organization provides scholarships to 10 or more students who do not all attend the same school,—such organization spends not less than 90 percent of the income of the organization on scholarships for eligible students,—such organization does not provide scholarships for any expenses other than qualified elementary or secondary education expenses,—such organization provides a scholarship to eligible students with a priority for——students awarded a scholarship the previous school year, and—after application of clause(i), any eligible students who have a sibling who was awarded a scholarship from such organization,—such organization does not earmark or set aside contributions for scholarships on behalf of any particular student, and—such organization——verifies the annual household income and family size of eligible students who apply for scholarships to ensure such students meet the requirement of subsection(c)(2)(A), and—limits the awarding of scholarships to eligible students who are a member of a household for which the income does not exceed the amount established under subsection(c)(2)(A).
conditions: ——such organization provides scholarships to 10 or more students who do not all attend the same school,—such organization spends not less than 90 percent of the income of the organization on scholarships for eligible students,—such organization does not provide scholarships for any expenses other than qualified elementary or secondary education expenses,—such organization provides a scholarship to eligible students with a priority for——students awarded a scholarship the previous school year, and—after application of clause(i), any eligible students who have a sibling who was awarded a scholarship from such organization,—such organization does not earmark or set aside contributions for scholarships on behalf of any particular student, and—such organization——verifies the annual household income and family size of eligible students who apply for scholarships to ensure such students meet the requirement of subsection(c)(2)(A), and—limits the awarding of scholarships to eligible students who are a member of a household for which the income does not exceed the amount established under subsection(c)(2)(A).

I.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)In General—An organization meets the requirements of this subsection if—I.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(A)—such organization provides scholarships to 10 or more students who do not all attend
                        the same school,I.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(B)—such organization spends not less than 90 percent of the income of the organization
                        on scholarships for eligible students,I.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(C)—such organization does not provide scholarships for any expenses other than qualified
                        elementary or secondary education expenses,I.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(D)—such organization provides a scholarship to eligible students with a priority for—I.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(D)(i)—students awarded a scholarship the previous school year, andI.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(D)(ii)—after application of clause(i), any eligible students who have a sibling who was awarded a scholarship from such
                           organization,I.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(E)—such organization does not earmark or set aside contributions for scholarships on
                        behalf of any particular student, andI.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(F)—such organization—I.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(F)(i)—verifies the annual household income and family size of eligible students who apply
                           for scholarships to ensure such students meet the requirement of subsection(c)(2)(A), andI.R.C. § 25F(d)(1)(F)(ii)—limits the awarding of scholarships to eligible students who are a member of a household
                           for which the income does not exceed the amount established under subsection(c)(2)(A).

title: General
text: A scholarship granting organization may not award a scholarship to any disqualified person.

logical_structure.result: A scholarship granting organization may not award a scholarship to any disqualified person.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(d)(2)(A)In General—A scholarship granting organization may not award a scholarship to any disqualified
                        person.

title: Person
text: For purposes of this paragraph, a disqualified person shall be determined pursuant to rules similar to the rules of section4946.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of this paragraph, a disqualified person shall be determined pursuant to rules similar to the rules of section4946.

cross_references.reason: rules similar to the rules of...

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(d)(2)(B)Disqualified Person—For purposes of this paragraph, a disqualified person shall be determined pursuant
                        to rules similar to the rules of section4946.

title: Of Double Benefit
text: Any qualified contribution for which a credit is allowed under this section shall not be taken into account as a charitable contribution for purposes of section170.

logical_structure.result: Any qualified contribution for which a credit is allowed under this section shall not be taken into account as a charitable contribution for purposes of section170.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(e)Denial Of Double Benefit—Any qualified contribution for which a credit is allowed under this section shall
                  not be taken into account as a charitable contribution for purposes of section170.

title: General
text: If the credit allowable under subsection(a)for any taxable year exceeds the limitation imposed by section26(a)for such taxable year reduced by the sum of the credits allowable under this subpart (other than this section, section23, and section25D), such excess shall be carried to the succeeding taxable year and added to the credit allowable under subsection(a)for such taxable year.
conditions: the credit allowable under subsection(a)for any taxable year exceeds the limitation imposed by section26(a)for such taxable year reduced by the sum of the credits allowable under this subpart (other than this section, section23, and section25D), such excess shall be carried to the succeeding taxable year and added to the credit allowable under subsection(a)for such taxable year.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(f)(1)In General—If the credit allowable under subsection(a)for any taxable year exceeds the limitation imposed by section26(a)for such taxable year reduced by the sum of the credits allowable under this subpart
                     (other than this section, section23, and section25D), such excess shall be carried to the succeeding taxable year and added to the credit
                     allowable under subsection(a)for such taxable year.

text: No credit may be carried forward under this subsection to any taxable year following the fifth taxable year after the taxable year in which the credit arose. For purposes of the preceding sentence, credits shall be treated as used on a first-in first-out basis.

logical_structure.result: No credit may be carried forward under this subsection to any taxable year following the fifth taxable year after the taxable year in which the credit arose. For purposes of the preceding sentence, credits shall be treated as used on a first-in first-out basis.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(f)(2)Limitation—No credit may be carried forward under this subsection to any taxable year following
                     the fifth taxable year after the taxable year in which the credit arose. For purposes
                     of the preceding sentence, credits shall be treated as used on a first-in first-out
                     basis.

title: General
text: Not later than January 1 of each calendar year (or, with respect to the first calendar year for which this section applies, as early as practicable), a State that voluntarily elects to participate under this section shall provide to the Secretary a list of the scholarship granting organizations that meet the requirements described in subsection(c)(5)and are located in the State.

logical_structure.result: Not later than January 1 of each calendar year (or, with respect to the first calendar year for which this section applies, as early as practicable), a State that voluntarily elects to participate under this section shall provide to the Secretary a list of the scholarship granting organizations that meet the requirements described in subsection(c)(5)and are located in the State.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(g)(1)(A)In General—Not later than January 1 of each calendar year (or, with respect to the first calendar
                        year for which this section applies, as early as practicable), a State that voluntarily
                        elects to participate under this section shall provide to the Secretary a list of
                        the scholarship granting organizations that meet the requirements described in subsection(c)(5)and are located in the State.

text: The election under this paragraph shall be made by the Governor of the State or by such other individual, agency, or entity as is designated under State law to make such elections on behalf of the State with respect to Federal tax benefits.

logical_structure.result: The election under this paragraph shall be made by the Governor of the State or by such other individual, agency, or entity as is designated under State law to make such elections on behalf of the State with respect to Federal tax benefits.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 25F(g)(1)(B)Process—The election under this paragraph shall be made by the Governor of the State or by
                        such other individual, agency, or entity as is designated under State law to make
                        such elections on behalf of the State with respect to Federal tax benefits.

text: Each list submitted under paragraph(1)shall include a certification that the individual, agency, or entity submitting such list on behalf of the State has the authority to perform this function.

logical_structure.result: Each list submitted under paragraph(1)shall include a certification that the individual, agency, or entity submitting such list on behalf of the State has the authority to perform this function.

I.R.C. § 25F(g)(2)Certification—Each list submitted under paragraph(1)shall include a certification that the individual, agency, or entity submitting such
                     list on behalf of the State has the authority to perform this function.

title: And Guidance
text: The Secretary shall issue such regulations or other guidance as the Secretary determines necessary to carry out the purposes of this section, including regulations or other guidance——providing for enforcement of the requirements under subsections(d)and(g), and—with respect to recordkeeping or information reporting for purposes of administering the requirements of this section.

logical_structure.result: The Secretary shall issue such regulations or other guidance as the Secretary determines necessary to carry out the purposes of this section, including regulations or other guidance——providing for enforcement of the requirements under subsections(d)and(g), and—with respect to recordkeeping or information reporting for purposes of administering the requirements of this section.

                  necessary to carry out the purposes of this section, including regulations or other
                  guidance—I.R.C. § 25F(h)(1)—providing for enforcement of the requirements under subsections(d)and(g), andI.R.C. § 25F(h)(2)—with respect to recordkeeping or information reporting for purposes of administering
